Package aima.core.robotics.datatypes

Interface IMclPose<P extends IMclPose<P,​V,​M>,​V extends IMclVector,​M extends IMclMove<M>>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - the class that is implementing this interface.
    V - an n-1-dimensional vector implementing IMclVector, where n is the dimensionality of the environment. This vector describes the angle between two rays in the environment.
    M - a movement (or sequence of movements) of the robot, implementing IMclMove.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IPose2D<P,​M>
    public interface IMclPose<P extends IMclPose<P,​V,​M>,​V extends IMclVector,​M extends IMclMove<M>>
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    A pose consists of a position in the environment and a heading in which the pose is facing.
    In a two-dimensional environment this would be an position represented through a point with (x,y) and an angle.
    In an n-dimensional environment the angle is represented through a vector.
    Author:
    Arno von Borries, Jan Phillip Kretzschmar, Andreas Walscheid

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      P addAngle​(V angle)
      Rotates a pose by a given IMclVector.
      This function should return a new object to prevent unpredictable behavior through more than one usage of the same pose.
      P applyMovement​(M move)
      Moves a pose according to a given move.
      This function should return a new object to prevent unpredictable behavior through more than one usage of the same pose.
      P clone()
      Clones an object according to Cloneable.
      double distanceTo​(P pose)
      Calculates the length of the straight line between this pose and another pose.
      x.distanceTo(y) has to return the same value as y.distanceTo(x).

    • Method Detail

      • applyMovement

        P applyMovement​(M move)
        Moves a pose according to a given move.
        This function should return a new object to prevent unpredictable behavior through more than one usage of the same pose.
        Parameters:
        move - the move to be added onto the pose.
        Returns:
        a new pose that has been moved.

      • addAngle

        P addAngle​(V angle)
        Rotates a pose by a given IMclVector.
        This function should return a new object to prevent unpredictable behavior through more than one usage of the same pose.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle by which the pose should be rotated.
        Returns:
        a new pose that has been rotated.

      • clone

        P clone()
        Clones an object according to Cloneable.
        Returns:
        a new pose with the same position and heading.

      • distanceTo

        double distanceTo​(P pose)
        Calculates the length of the straight line between this pose and another pose.
        x.distanceTo(y) has to return the same value as y.distanceTo(x).
        Parameters:
        pose - another pose to which the distance is calculated.
        Returns:
        the distance between the two poses.
